name: chatgpt_prod_offshore_gdb_fz_c5m
description: [GPT Prod] Offshore + GDB FZ â†’ BLOCK (C3 vs C5-M), suggest RF/SF
query: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 mÂ³/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

turns.content: We require GDB 600x600 in Galvanized (FZ) for an offshore platform. Airflow: 3,400 mÂ³/h. The unit will be exposed to salty sea air (C5-M). Please confirm compliance.

For the offshore platform application, the GDB housing with a C2 corrosion class is not suitable for the marine environment due to the presence of Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion of the galvanized (FZ) material. Outdoor installation causes condensation on the housing. High humidity will further accelerate corrosion.The GDB family is therefore blocked for this project. The bolted construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_MARINE installation, which typically requires welded construction to ensure proper sealing and hygiene. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a critical engineering failure in the user's request. The user requested a Galvanized (FZ) housing for an offshore (C5-M) environment, which would lead to rapid corrosion. The system correctly used PDF data (GDB is rated for indoor/C2 use) and domain knowledge (C5 requires stainless/acid-proof steel) to block the unsafe configuration.

dimension_explanations.correctness: The system correctly states GDB is standard C2/Indoor (PDF p.8) and FZ is unsuitable for C5 marine environments (PDF p.4 lists RF/SF/ZM for C5).
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response addresses the material mismatch, the environmental constraints, and provides a recommendation for custom engineering.
dimension_explanations.safety: Excellent safety logic; installing galvanized steel in a C5-M offshore environment is a major risk which the system correctly blocked.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and authoritative regarding the technical rejection.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The logic linking salt spray and humidity to the corrosion of galvanized material is sound HVAC/materials engineering.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adhered to the 'Indoor use' (Inomhusbruk) and corrosion class constraints defined in the PDF.

strengths: Correctly identified material-environment mismatch (FZ vs C5-M)
Prioritized safety over completing a sale
Accurately referenced product limitations (GDB is Indoor/C2)
pdf_citations: GDB: 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (For indoor use) and 'Korrosivitets klass C2' (PDF p.8)
Material FZ: 'Korrosivitets klass C3' (PDF p.4) - confirming unsuitability for C5

For more information on this error, read the docs: https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/error-codes/api-errors.', 'type': 'insufficient_quota', 'param': None, 'code': 'insufficient_quota'}}

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that galvanized (FZ) material rated C2/C3 is wholly inadequate for a C5-M offshore marine environment, which is sound engineering. However, it makes some incorrect claims (GDB is described as 'bolted construction' unsuitable for marine when the real issue is purely material/corrosion class) and fails to suggest viable alternatives like GDB in RF (stainless steel, C5) or ZM (Magnelis, C5), which are listed as available material options for GDB in the catalog.

dimension_explanations.correctness: GDB 600x600 at 3,400 mÂ³/h matches the PDF (p.9), and FZ is indeed C3 per the catalog (p.4), not C5 â€” correct to flag. However, claiming GDB has 'bolted construction' that fails 'leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine' is inaccurate; GDB is a standard duct-mounted housing, and the PDF lists RF/SF/ZM as available materials for GDB which would meet C5.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The system fails to suggest GDB in RF (C5) or ZM (C5) as viable alternatives, which are explicitly listed material options for GDB on p.8, making the 'no standard catalog product' claim incorrect and the response incomplete.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks the FZ material for a C5-M offshore environment â€” this is the right safety call and prevents a dangerous corrosion failure.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, appropriately directs to custom engineering, though the unnecessary system-internal label 'ENV_MARINE' slightly detracts.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: The core corrosion reasoning is sound (FZ C3 < C5-M requirement), but the additional claims about 'bolted construction' and 'hygiene requirements' for marine environments are unsupported logical leaps that muddy the reasoning.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Correctly enforces the material/corrosion constraint for FZ in marine environments, but overly blocks the entire GDB family when alternative materials (RF, ZM) would satisfy the constraint.

strengths: Correctly identifies that galvanized steel (FZ, C3) is inadequate for C5-M offshore marine environments
Appropriately blocks the unsafe configuration and directs user to seek further assistance
weaknesses: Fails to recommend GDB in RF (stainless steel, C5) or ZM (Magnelis, C5), which are catalog-listed material options for GDB that would satisfy C5-M requirements
Introduces incorrect claims about 'bolted construction' failing 'leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine' â€” the real issue is purely material corrosion class, not construction type
pdf_citations: GDB material options include FZ, AZ, RF, SF, ZM (PDF p.8, material icons at top)
FZ (FÃ¶rzinkat): Corrosion class C3 (PDF p.4); RF (Rostfri): Corrosion class C5 (PDF p.4); ZM: Corrosion class C5 (PDF p.4)

content_segments.text: For the offshore platform application, the GDB housing with a C2 corrosion class is not suitable for the marine environment due to the presence of Salt Spray, Outdoor Condensation, and High Humidity. Salt spray accelerates corrosion of the galvanized (FZ) material. Outdoor installation causes condensation on the housing. High humidity will further accelerate corrosion.
inference_logic: Salt Spray: accelerates zinc corrosion, requiring C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance.
Outdoor Condensation: causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, requiring a double-wall insulated housing.
High Humidity: accelerates zinc corrosion, suggesting C4 or C5 materials.

content_segments.text: The GDB family is therefore blocked for this project. The bolted construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.

Unfortunately, no standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. A solution would need to be rated for ENV_MARINE installation, which typically requires welded construction to ensure proper sealing and hygiene. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.
